intro: Peristylus mannii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has strap-like, evergreen leaves that form a dense rosette near the ground. Peristylus mannii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. It is also valued for its ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade conditions.
